structure.unit: DIVISION 2. CIVIL SERVICE FOR COUNTY EMPLOYEES

text.section:
Sec. 2-51. Election duties, required.
Notwithstanding any other provision of this Code or the civil service rules and regulations, the County Manager, in the manager's sole discretion, may direct such county employees as the manager deems necessary to serve as election clerks, deputy custodians, inspectors, supervisors, officers and officials incident to the conduct of any election held within Miami-Dade County. The manager shall, however, first endeavor to secure County employees to serve in such capacities on a voluntary basis. The foregoing power shall be deemed to include all implied powers necessary and proper to carrying out such power including but not limited to providing appropriate instruction and training, and specifying the locations, hours, terms and conditions, duties and compensation for such election service.
